intro: Colchicum autumnale var. pannonicum, commonly known as the autumn crocus or meadow crocus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Colchicaceae and is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces distinctive, helmet-shaped seed capsules. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or meadow habitats. Due to its toxic alkaloids, it is important to handle the plant with care.
